tweets.text:
We‚Äôve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil now on site gathering information & evidence. https://t.co/LLCOFQHCox

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

@D_1983_D @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm This has not work for the EA. It is a protect area so now changes should be made. It might look neat and tidy but it will cause issues further down steam as possibly causing flooding.

We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

"Be in no doubt that anything less than a prosecution and full restoration of the river, paid for by the perpetrator, will be acceptable‚Äù.

@EnvAgency and others want to prove they are fit for the 21st century? Here's your chance. https://t.co/ji0wmcYyhf

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t
@CraigBennett3 @JohnSensible @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WildlifeTrusts Thats not the same location!!
We're taking reports of environmental damage to the #SSSI at the #RiverLugg very seriously, and are working with @EnvAgency and @ForestryComm to take immediate action. https://t.co/27DINp3vD7

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Thank you. Please prosecute and fine. There must be really harsh penalties as deterrent for this kind of behaviour - crimes against nature (and communities) can no longer go unseen and unpunished. üòî
@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil WHILE YOU'RE AT IT, YOU CAN INVESTIGATE THE CRIMES OF #HS2 AS WELL!!!
@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil This is very encouraging. Thank you

@TCNAndrew @deepredfish @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil @guardian @guardianphotos @TelegraphPics A few years ago I stood on the banks of the Severn behind the flood defences at Upton upon Severn watching the turbid brown soil-laden waters racing by nearly topping the barriers. "Dredge dredge dredge" was the call from all there who I spoke to.
@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil The alarm was raised on the 24th November, cannot believe its taken this long to respond

@EnvAgency @RosieP4 @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm It's happening up & down the country - not just here. Nature, trees, wildlife, greenbelt, green spaces etc. are being destroyed at an alarming rate. Development & economy are king - HS2 as 1 example & billions¬£¬£¬£'s of planned roads another + #BuildBuildBuild on greenfield land.

urls.title: Environment Agency slashes number of water pollution incident visits
urls.description: Huge drop in number of visits during Covid crisis raises concerns polluters are breaking laws with impunity

tweets.text: Guardian: @EnvAgency slashes number of water pollution incident visits amid rising fears water industry is now polluting UK rivers with impunity putting the health of river users and unique ecosystems at risk https://t.co/FbjqetyRzY via @Feargal_Sharkey @bilgribs

What a mess. #RiverLugg #Herefordshire 
Environmental vandalism
@NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK 
Wildlife habitat destroyed nature erased.
Downstream flooding risk, erosion and mud deposition risks greatly increased
Fish spawning areas obliterated
SSSI seriously damaged https://t.co/jYUlV74vLw
This is more like it @EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @JamesBevanEA Well done EA people - let's see what happens of course but you are through the door. https://t.co/Ef5clXXF2V
absolutely pathetic. waste of tax payers money. https://t.co/AXeufQar8Y

tweets.text: @DavidJCrook @LaxBowel @RobGMacfarlane @mildthing99 @EnvAgency Right here .. https://t.co/tqoFZobg9n

@TamFinkelstein @EnvAgency @flowonthegoltd @UK_CEH 4 second video captured and processed on standard iPhone. Colours = water speed. Just one of the tools I'm working on at @UK_CEH to meet the growing challenges of flood and drought. (Yes, I'm at UKCEH Now!!)

tweets.text:
.@EnvAgencyMids is calling for those responsible for stripping away trees from a mile of the River Lugg to be prosecuted. 
@HerefordshireWT says decades of damage has been done, destroying an important habitat for fish, birds and mammals. https://t.co/8NHPrlu2m9

Curiouser and curiouser.

The redoubtable @bettwsresident CEO of @WUFoundation making it very clear  that @EnvAgencyMids were alerted to the destruction that was taking place on the River Lugg last week. 

Did EA the respond? If not why not.

Starts 8:37

https://t.co/XbNCDTpqIL

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil They should be made to accept beavers on their land with large scale tree planting - won‚Äôt take a couple of beavers long to sort out the devastation & provide numerous habitats for other wildlife. #beavers

@Patrici46119638 @KmunityOfEquals @Sophie_Clare3 @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil @HerefordshireWT Why would naming them jeopardise it? People are regularly named in the press when arrested for other crimes
@RobGMacfarlane @laurenstjohn @EnvAgency Why? Who is responsible and why did they do it?

Most of the üåè's biodiversity lies beneath our feet!  

#SoilBiodiversity helps üëá

üíädevelop new medicines

We need to protect this precious resource.
